episodes.description: In this show, Jo and Cherokee explain what it takes to become an ITIL Master. Jo walks through the certification process and offers several tips to assist you through this process.
episodes.title: How to Become ITIL Master
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.270 --> 00:00:02.052
Welcome to IT ProTV I'm
your host Don Pezet.

2
00:00:02.052 --> 00:00:06.054
[CROSSTALK]

3
00:00:06.054 --> 00:00:08.229
[MUSIC]

4
00:00:08.229 --> 00:00:11.828
>> You're watching ITProTV.

5
00:00:11.828 --> 00:00:12.766
>> Welcome ladies and gentlemen.

6
00:00:12.766 --> 00:00:15.548
If you have ever wondered how
to become an ITIL master,

7
00:00:15.548 --> 00:00:17.880
well then this is the show you.

8
00:00:17.880 --> 00:00:19.710
I'm your host Cherokee Boose.

9
00:00:19.710 --> 00:00:24.220
In this episode we have ITIL master
Jo Peacock in studios to explain and

10
00:00:24.220 --> 00:00:25.970
help you through this process.

11
00:00:25.970 --> 00:00:27.330
So Jo where do we begin?

12
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:31.330
Obviously this is a pretty prestigious
certification to be able to obtain,

13
00:00:31.330 --> 00:00:35.820
so I might be a little nervous or
a little uneasy about this process and

14
00:00:35.820 --> 00:00:36.960
I'm hoping you can help with that.

15
00:00:36.960 --> 00:00:39.075
>> Well,
you got every right to be nervous.

16
00:00:39.075 --> 00:00:44.280
[LAUGH] I'm a little bit sort of
reticent about the whole process.

17
00:00:44.280 --> 00:00:47.920
The first thing that I
want you to ask yourself

18
00:00:47.920 --> 00:00:50.920
Is why do I need to become an ITIL master?

19
00:00:50.920 --> 00:00:53.040
And that's a legitimate question.

20
00:00:53.040 --> 00:00:58.290
The ITIL master qualification, as a
process, is approximately two years long.

21
00:00:58.290 --> 00:01:02.105
Or a maximum of two years long,
depending on how you approach this and

22
00:01:02.105 --> 00:01:05.455
so you have to ask yourself,
it's a PhD equivalent.

23
00:01:05.455 --> 00:01:09.995
Do you actually really need to have
the ITIL master certification?

24
00:01:09.995 --> 00:01:13.415
It's not exactly an easy
certification to gain and

25
00:01:13.415 --> 00:01:16.245
it's a certification where
you have to demonstrate

26
00:01:16.245 --> 00:01:21.810
in a real world example that you have
implemented all of the elements of ITIL.

27
00:01:21.810 --> 00:01:24.380
All of them, not just some of them,

28
00:01:24.380 --> 00:01:28.700
all of them in a real world situation,
so you can't make it up either.

29
00:01:30.050 --> 00:01:33.460
And you have to have
evidence of this as well.

30
00:01:33.460 --> 00:01:37.370
So is it something that
everybody can achieve?

31
00:01:37.370 --> 00:01:40.360
Is it something everybody needs
to achieve or wants to achieve?

32
00:01:40.360 --> 00:01:41.920
And the answer to that is no.

33
00:01:43.200 --> 00:01:47.990
For most, the ITIL expert certification
is the prestige that you need.

34
00:01:47.990 --> 00:01:52.130
It's the equivalent of the version
two ITIL service manager.

35
00:01:52.130 --> 00:01:55.240
And in which case,
then as a service manager, as an expert,

36
00:01:55.240 --> 00:01:59.570
then that is more than sufficient
to both implement ITIL and

37
00:01:59.570 --> 00:02:04.340
to be able to manage ITIL based
frameworks in your environment.

38
00:02:04.340 --> 00:02:06.563
Let's just take a look at
the qualifications theme right now.

39
00:02:06.563 --> 00:02:10.988
You'll see that what we have in our
qualification scheme is you have in

40
00:02:10.988 --> 00:02:14.440
the red at the top,
you have the ITIL expert.

41
00:02:14.440 --> 00:02:16.440
And you have the ITIL
master above that and

42
00:02:16.440 --> 00:02:19.070
right at the very bottom, ITIL Foundation.

43
00:02:19.070 --> 00:02:23.468
ITIL Foundation is something that
most organizations how are looking to

44
00:02:23.468 --> 00:02:28.370
implement an ITIL based framework,
well they will expect they're employees,

45
00:02:28.370 --> 00:02:33.320
their staff to have achieved
The ITIL Foundation certification.

46
00:02:33.320 --> 00:02:37.250
What ITIL Foundation does
is that ITIL Foundation,

47
00:02:37.250 --> 00:02:42.640
it will give you an understanding,
a foundation if you want,

48
00:02:42.640 --> 00:02:45.960
but an understanding
of the ITIL framework.

49
00:02:47.310 --> 00:02:48.450
ITIL's not plug and play.

50
00:02:49.470 --> 00:02:52.020
As a framework,
it's not a one size fits all approach.

51
00:02:52.020 --> 00:02:53.660
So you can't simply take
it out of the book and

52
00:02:53.660 --> 00:02:58.520
then apply it and implement it in your
organization and expect it to work.

53
00:02:58.520 --> 00:02:59.410
If you do that,

54
00:02:59.410 --> 00:03:04.030
I can tell you now you're going to end up
with more chaos than you started off with.

55
00:03:04.030 --> 00:03:06.650
It doesn't work like that,
it's a framework.

56
00:03:06.650 --> 00:03:08.610
We'll tell you what
processes you need to have.

57
00:03:08.610 --> 00:03:13.230
And it's up to you, then,
to take the ITIL framework, and

58
00:03:13.230 --> 00:03:16.120
to adapt to suit your environment.

59
00:03:16.120 --> 00:03:19.610
And so
ITIL Practitioner will help you do that.

60
00:03:19.610 --> 00:03:23.650
Cuz the ITIL Practitioner course,

61
00:03:23.650 --> 00:03:29.380
the ITIL Practitioner show that we
have here on ITProTV, well that

62
00:03:29.380 --> 00:03:34.530
actually works with you to
identify areas for improvement.

63
00:03:34.530 --> 00:03:39.250
To identify exactly where you can improve,

64
00:03:39.250 --> 00:03:44.562
what you can implement, and
how you can adapt ITIL to implement it.

65
00:03:44.562 --> 00:03:47.980
ITIL Practitioner,
I look at this diagram and

66
00:03:47.980 --> 00:03:51.700
I don't like this diagram and
I'll tell you why.

67
00:03:51.700 --> 00:03:55.900
Because ITIL Practitioner,
when we used to show diagrams before when

68
00:03:55.900 --> 00:03:59.260
ITIL Practitioner first
was released in 2016,

69
00:03:59.260 --> 00:04:04.000
ITIL Practitioner was always
shown off to the side.

70
00:04:04.000 --> 00:04:08.760
So it was actually showing off sort
of to this side of the diagram itself

71
00:04:08.760 --> 00:04:13.420
because ITIL practitioner takes all of
the knowledge that you previously had and

72
00:04:13.420 --> 00:04:18.020
then it then works with
that knowledge to help

73
00:04:18.020 --> 00:04:23.310
you implement ITIL to help you
identify improvement opportunities.

74
00:04:23.310 --> 00:04:27.960
ITIL Practitioner is actually the study,
the class,

75
00:04:27.960 --> 00:04:31.530
the guide, the show,
whatever you want to call it.

76
00:04:31.530 --> 00:04:34.790
It's that element that will
help you implement ITIL.

77
00:04:36.460 --> 00:04:38.810
ITIL Master won't help you implement ITIL.

78
00:04:38.810 --> 00:04:41.930
ITIL Master just demonstrates
that you have implemented ITIL.

79
00:04:43.060 --> 00:04:47.485
If you actually want to implement an ITIL
based framework in the real world,

80
00:04:47.485 --> 00:04:50.430
ITIL Practitioner is what you need.

81
00:04:50.430 --> 00:04:56.050
>> So, what I'm gathering Jo, is if I'm
not familiar with the ITIL framework and

82
00:04:56.050 --> 00:04:58.860
the exact disciplines here,
this is not the place for that.

83
00:04:58.860 --> 00:05:02.930
I already should know that knowledge,
it's an implied knowledge at this point.

84
00:05:02.930 --> 00:05:04.320
>> Well,
it's not just an implied knowledge,

85
00:05:04.320 --> 00:05:07.200
but ITIL expert is based on experience.

86
00:05:07.200 --> 00:05:09.270
So you have to have implemented it, okay?

87
00:05:09.270 --> 00:05:10.860
>> So this is not way around it.

88
00:05:10.860 --> 00:05:15.480
>> Right, there's no way around this at
all, you have to have implemented ITIL.

89
00:05:15.480 --> 00:05:21.203
This is not, it's not optional,
it's not just based on theory.

90
00:05:21.203 --> 00:05:26.277
You cannot read all of the ITIL books and
absorb all of the ITIL books and even have

91
00:05:26.277 --> 00:05:31.600
read the ITIL practitioner guidance and
then think, well that's okay then.

92
00:05:31.600 --> 00:05:34.540
Now that I'm an ITIL expert,
I can become an ITIL master.

93
00:05:34.540 --> 00:05:37.890
Because that's not how it works,
it's based on theory.

94
00:05:37.890 --> 00:05:40.400
And it's based on evidence-based theory.

95
00:05:40.400 --> 00:05:42.650
So it's not based on theory,
it's based on evidence.

96
00:05:42.650 --> 00:05:44.447
It's based on practical evidence.

97
00:05:44.447 --> 00:05:48.590
You have to have implemented ITIL.

98
00:05:48.590 --> 00:05:53.660
So, ITIL Practitioner is probably
what most people are looking for.

99
00:05:53.660 --> 00:05:58.840
Most people are looking for something to
help them and something that demonstrates

100
00:05:58.840 --> 00:06:03.692
that they know how to implement ITIL,
and that's what ITIL Practitioner does.

101
00:06:03.692 --> 00:06:09.290
Now, personally, I like,
I personally prefer

102
00:06:09.290 --> 00:06:13.775
individuals to complete ITIL Practitioner
after they've completed what we call our

103
00:06:13.775 --> 00:06:18.220
intermediates, which are our life cycle
modules and our capability modules.

104
00:06:18.220 --> 00:06:22.250
And you can complete,
if you want to become an ITIL expert,

105
00:06:22.250 --> 00:06:26.170
you can complete either, well,
either the life cycle modules,

106
00:06:26.170 --> 00:06:30.840
as you see on the left hand side or
you can complete the capability modules.

107
00:06:30.840 --> 00:06:35.590
And the capability modules look more at a,
now what I would call a practitioner with

108
00:06:35.590 --> 00:06:40.670
lower case p, at the practitioner
side of implementing processes, but

109
00:06:40.670 --> 00:06:42.710
they're very much theory-based.

110
00:06:42.710 --> 00:06:46.475
Managing across the life
cycle is a course,

111
00:06:46.475 --> 00:06:50.341
a class that looks at
the entire life cycle but

112
00:06:50.341 --> 00:06:54.841
from a senior management,
from a CIO perspective.

113
00:06:54.841 --> 00:06:59.405
But you see what we've done in all
of these, in the intermediates,

114
00:06:59.405 --> 00:07:04.368
in the MALC as we like to call it,
managing across the life cycle, in all of

115
00:07:04.368 --> 00:07:09.850
those tests and in all of those shows,
what we've looked at is just the theory.

116
00:07:09.850 --> 00:07:11.633
We've looked at the theory of ITIL.

117
00:07:11.633 --> 00:07:15.945
And at no point in time and what we were
finding was that we were getting were

118
00:07:15.945 --> 00:07:19.427
people that had achieved
the ITIL expert certification and

119
00:07:19.427 --> 00:07:22.020
then after that they'd said, right okay.

120
00:07:22.020 --> 00:07:22.710
Well this is great.

121
00:07:22.710 --> 00:07:24.640
I've got all this knowledge and
all this theory and

122
00:07:24.640 --> 00:07:26.790
I don't know how to implement it.

123
00:07:26.790 --> 00:07:30.970
And this is where ITIL Practitioner comes
in cuz ITIL Practitioner says okay,

124
00:07:30.970 --> 00:07:33.390
let's work out a starting point then for
you.

125
00:07:33.390 --> 00:07:36.764
Let's work out how you can adapt
ITIL to suit your environment.

126
00:07:36.764 --> 00:07:39.900
And that's what ITIL Practitioner is for.

127
00:07:39.900 --> 00:07:45.766
Now, you don't have to take either all of
the life cycle and all of the capability.

128
00:07:45.766 --> 00:07:47.040
You can mix and match,

129
00:07:47.040 --> 00:07:50.931
and, of course, for those of you
that are considering ITIL master,

130
00:07:50.931 --> 00:07:55.763
you've already been through this process
and you've already got yourself to a point

131
00:07:55.763 --> 00:08:01.390
where you have The prerequisite number of
points to be able to achieve ITIL Expert.

132
00:08:01.390 --> 00:08:06.900
You will achieve ITIL Expert
automatically on two conditions.

133
00:08:06.900 --> 00:08:10.362
That you have achieved your 22 credits,
and

134
00:08:10.362 --> 00:08:15.260
that those 22 credits include
managing across the life cycle.

135
00:08:15.260 --> 00:08:19.889
So you have achieve 17 credits
before you get to qualify for

136
00:08:19.889 --> 00:08:22.540
managing across the life cycle.

137
00:08:22.540 --> 00:08:25.141
And then, you can take managing
across the life cycle, and then,

138
00:08:25.141 --> 00:08:26.310
you can achieve ITIL Expert.

139
00:08:26.310 --> 00:08:31.096
Now you can be incredibly sad like me,
and you do them all, but

140
00:08:31.096 --> 00:08:32.534
then-
>> Woo-hoo.

141
00:08:32.534 --> 00:08:35.630
>> [LAUGH] I figured, well-
>> What happened, Jo?

142
00:08:35.630 --> 00:08:38.410
You just couldn't choose which
one was your favorite, or?

143
00:08:38.410 --> 00:08:39.930
>> I don't know, I didn't get a choice.

144
00:08:39.930 --> 00:08:44.375
[LAUGH] This is one of the problems
when you've been involved in

145
00:08:44.375 --> 00:08:48.890
ITIL from the actual authors,
where we wrote ITIL.

146
00:08:48.890 --> 00:08:52.280
Yeah, you don't get any choice in this.

147
00:08:52.280 --> 00:08:54.825
[LAUGH] So yeah, so all of them.

148
00:08:54.825 --> 00:08:58.960
[LAUGH] But then,
it's up to you to pick and choose.

149
00:08:58.960 --> 00:09:03.480
You need to get to 17, and you have to
have completed ITIL Foundation, and

150
00:09:03.480 --> 00:09:06.560
you have to have completed
managing across the life cycle.

151
00:09:06.560 --> 00:09:13.140
And how you make up the 17, well, it's
really 15 because two is from foundation.

152
00:09:13.140 --> 00:09:17.050
You've gotta make up another 15 before you
can take managing across the life cycle.

153
00:09:17.050 --> 00:09:23.820
But you're ITIL expert tells you
that you have achieved the theory.

154
00:09:23.820 --> 00:09:25.930
That you understand the ITIL theory.

155
00:09:25.930 --> 00:09:30.150
An ITIL practitioner teaches
you how to apply that theory.

156
00:09:30.150 --> 00:09:35.810
ITIL Master then tests that
you have applied that theory.

157
00:09:35.810 --> 00:09:38.150
So what is ITIL Master then?

158
00:09:38.150 --> 00:09:42.080
It actually says, right at the very top
there, it is an assessment qualification.

159
00:09:42.080 --> 00:09:46.340
And it is, it's gonna take you
about six to 24 months duration.

160
00:09:47.490 --> 00:09:50.160
It's a thesis style qualification, and

161
00:09:50.160 --> 00:09:52.660
I'll come more into that
a little bit later.

162
00:09:52.660 --> 00:09:56.180
It is experienced based,
though isn't a training course.

163
00:09:57.840 --> 00:10:00.984
There is a prerequisite, and
the prerequisite is that you

164
00:10:00.984 --> 00:10:04.398
are an ITIL Expert,
that's most definitely a prerequisite.

165
00:10:04.398 --> 00:10:10.097
And that you have to have had a minimum
of five years in IT management or

166
00:10:10.097 --> 00:10:13.553
IT leadership, a minimum of five years.

167
00:10:13.553 --> 00:10:20.302
So you have to be an IT Master,
so you have to be an IT manager.

168
00:10:20.302 --> 00:10:26.340
And you have to have demonstrated, and by
the way, we need your resume or your CV.

169
00:10:26.340 --> 00:10:31.100
You have to have demonstrated that you
have been in an IT management position for

170
00:10:31.100 --> 00:10:33.560
at least five years.

171
00:10:33.560 --> 00:10:36.320
We're also gonna ask for
references, as well.

172
00:10:36.320 --> 00:10:38.702
Just a word of warning here.

173
00:10:38.702 --> 00:10:41.414
As it says here, and this in in quotes,

174
00:10:41.414 --> 00:10:45.270
this is directly from
the ITIL Master guidelines.

175
00:10:45.270 --> 00:10:47.610
And it just simply says,
to achieve ITIL Master,

176
00:10:47.610 --> 00:10:52.460
you've got to be able to explain and
to justify how you have applied

177
00:10:53.780 --> 00:10:55.910
your knowledge, and
your principles, and your methods.

178
00:10:55.910 --> 00:10:58.619
Your ITIL knowledge, and
your principles, and

179
00:10:58.619 --> 00:11:01.140
your methods to achieve business outcomes.

180
00:11:01.140 --> 00:11:03.832
And it says in one or
more practical assignments,

181
00:11:03.832 --> 00:11:06.000
trust me it's a lot more than one.

182
00:11:06.000 --> 00:11:08.210
And it's gonna be between ten and

183
00:11:08.210 --> 00:11:13.190
20 different assignments that you're going
to be asked to do, between ten and 20.

184
00:11:13.190 --> 00:11:15.730
We'll talk a little bit more about that.

185
00:11:15.730 --> 00:11:17.270
Probably, in our next episode,

186
00:11:17.270 --> 00:11:19.900
when we just get a little bit
more into the meat of this.

187
00:11:21.130 --> 00:11:24.440
But it's a thesis style qualification, and

188
00:11:24.440 --> 00:11:28.780
you will be expected to
compile assignments.

189
00:11:28.780 --> 00:11:30.610
I've already said between ten or

190
00:11:30.610 --> 00:11:34.660
20 different assignments
that you have to compile,

191
00:11:34.660 --> 00:11:39.110
that you have to submit in exactly
the same way as if you were at university.

192
00:11:39.110 --> 00:11:43.500
You would have to submit and
they would be assessed.

193
00:11:43.500 --> 00:11:46.880
They would be marked by
two individual assessors.

194
00:11:46.880 --> 00:11:49.250
So there's no bias there,

195
00:11:49.250 --> 00:11:54.230
you can't claim that there's any sort of,
you can't claim that this.

196
00:11:54.230 --> 00:11:57.690
>> They just didn't like me Jo, and
that's why I didn't get my certification.

197
00:11:57.690 --> 00:12:00.650
>> Right.
>> But having an additional individual

198
00:12:00.650 --> 00:12:02.060
will help even the playing field.

199
00:12:02.060 --> 00:12:02.945
>> There are two assessors, yes.

200
00:12:02.945 --> 00:12:04.834
>> Okay.
>> It's very similar to how it used to be

201
00:12:04.834 --> 00:12:05.945
within ITIL version two.

202
00:12:05.945 --> 00:12:09.760
Your exams were always
assessed by two examiners.

203
00:12:09.760 --> 00:12:12.290
In this case, then yes,
you have two examiners or

204
00:12:12.290 --> 00:12:15.700
assessors that will assess
each of your papers.

205
00:12:15.700 --> 00:12:21.570
So as I said, there's no claim of yeah,
the examiner just didn't like me.

206
00:12:21.570 --> 00:12:23.575
And that's the reason why I didn't pass.

207
00:12:23.575 --> 00:12:25.030
Because, and it's not just that,

208
00:12:25.030 --> 00:12:27.273
you're gonna get an interview afterwards,
as well.

209
00:12:27.273 --> 00:12:31.670
So we're gonna ask for references,
we're going to interview you.

210
00:12:31.670 --> 00:12:35.086
We are going to assess your submissions.

211
00:12:35.086 --> 00:12:39.880
It's not a short process like we say,
it says between six to 24 months.

212
00:12:39.880 --> 00:12:45.490
I have never known anybody that has
completed it in less than 18 months,

213
00:12:45.490 --> 00:12:46.130
never.

214
00:12:46.130 --> 00:12:48.230
There's a lot of work to be done.

215
00:12:48.230 --> 00:12:52.238
And I have actually had people that I've
coached through ITIL Master in the past,

216
00:12:52.238 --> 00:12:54.122
where they've come to me and said.

217
00:12:54.122 --> 00:12:58.900
Well, you know what, we implemented an
ITIL based framework in our organization.

218
00:12:58.900 --> 00:13:02.400
So I've decided to write a book about it,
and what I'm going to do is I'm gonna

219
00:13:02.400 --> 00:13:08.944
submit that book as my proposal for
my ITIL Master.

220
00:13:08.944 --> 00:13:10.759
>> Okay.
>> And I had to turn around to them and

221
00:13:10.759 --> 00:13:14.630
say, well, there's nothing
wrong with you writing a book.

222
00:13:14.630 --> 00:13:19.288
But that book is not going to be
